urls.title: UK environmental protections 'being flouted'
urls.description: Campaigners say UK government protections on the environment are already being flouted.

tweets.text:
Rhetoric from powers-that-be now greener but actions have yet to catch up. We continue to see habitats ripped out here in #Essex and main environmental watchdog @EnvAgency gives permits to waste incinerators but fails to look after our local rivers.
https://t.co/VoJAxQ26fB

Readings taken on Stinkerdale Road ST5 this morning, by the Redindustries2 dump.   If the EA are not too busy patting themselves on the back about flood defences maybe they could take action @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgencyMids #StopTheStink #stinkstopthe https://t.co/0c4X0K5MC5

A cracking day of searching for smelt, resulted in a further seven fish being tagged this afternoon. All fish were in fantastic condition with one weighing in at 5.5oz, one ounce shy of the British record. As per Sunday, lots of juv bass and two bonus thin-lipped mullet. 🥒 https://t.co/U06Md9BiuE

If @thenoblefoods won't answer, should these big polluters be included under the Environmental Information Regs to force them to? @pow_rebecca As the @EnvAgency is clearly out of its depth. https://t.co/zTxrEFUl1W

tweets.text: Well that was a stormy couple of days considering it wasn't a named #storm?! Plenty of #Cumbria #Rain too. Always amazes me how much more we get at #Honister and upper #Borowdale. 🌨️🌨️🌨️  @EnvAgencyNW @metoffice @metofficeNWEng @met https://t.co/e0W8DfEvmh

Anyone managing waste outside the law is committing #WasteCrime.

We successfully seized this truck, believed to be involved in waste crime, in a joint operation with the police.

Help us continue our fight by completing the Waste Crime Survey 👇

https://t.co/S6bV2wnn2w https://t.co/qpp8Kf2bcV

A grainy picture but ace to see the leaky dams we installed last week have passed thier first BIG test with flying colours! V happy that there is still extra capacity behind each structure to slow / store larger storm events. @CumbriaCC @NTsouthlakes @SCRiversTrust  @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/ufXYSNovSM
This piece of work is huge in scale and only eclipsed by the challenge getting to this point!  Thanks to @EnvAgencyNW @RibbleValleyBC too https://t.co/IuTnXvcCuT

urls.title: Precious chalk stream in Bexley gets health boost - Thames21
urls.description: Bexley residents and local wildlife can now enjoy a healthier river Cray where it flows through Foots Cray Meadows, Bexley.Waterways charity Thames21 has carried out restoration work on an 800m stretch of the river

tweets.text: This month we complete our restoration works on the river Cray, #Bexley, in partnership with @LBofBexley @EnovertCT & @EnvAgency. We can't wait to see the positive impacts of rewilding this river, like more plants, birds & fish thriving 🐟 Read more: https://t.co/x04GRodbUL https://t.co/qdz6Tw2h9J

We cannot fully address the climate emergency without taking into account its disproportionate impact on women and children.

This #IWD2021, @EmmaHowardBoyd, @pow_rebecca and @MarianSpain explain why it's so vital that women's voices are heard.

#TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/oUJ5jCI6wT

urls.title: Youth Voice Summit - Rethinking Water
urls.description: A chance for you to input your opinions and experiences on future water management and how you would like to engage in giving your opinion in the decisions made by the Environment Agency in the future.

tweets.text:
We have teamed up with @EnvAgency for an online event and would like to know young people’s opinions on future water management, youth engagement and future governance.

🗓️Tuesday 16 March
📣Inspiring guest speakers 
🗨️Take part in a Q&A

Sign up here👇
https://t.co/Gmx3uHGWJI https://t.co/ytACS1HL8H

Out surveying water quality in streams in Ilkley today as part of our Wharfedale partnership and the new bathing water designation #waterstory #bathingwater @YorkshireWater @YorkDalesRT @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/F9xyNoNmnz

My first public meeting tonight, re: Welsh Harp SSSI neglect.
Astounded at the doublespeak & circumlocution. 
Appalled at how much money is wasted. 
Angered at the lack of accountability by organisations in charge incl. @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency 
Citizens must act and monitor. https://t.co/btZLt2rlPp

Guy Linley-Adams solicitor for @SalmonTroutCons
reminds @CommonsEAC that water companies have a legal obligation to PROACTIVELY make their sewage data available. "It's exactly that information water users.... need before they get in the water".

So where is it @EnvAgency @Ofwat? https://t.co/S0zu7TCjWt

The Environment Agency's given Anglian Water special permission to pump sewage into a river “to help relieve pressure on our wastewater network which has been overwhelmed due to recent high volume of wet weather in the area". https://t.co/QzphbNhzpF

Interesting from @CBItweets in this article. Here’s my speech last week about regulation and why polluters must pay: https://t.co/Bpr1JwGWx8 https://t.co/qkQDmrdKWf https://t.co/LfsLADvjZ4

HS2 want to widen this road. You will notice that there is a field next to it. So why cut all the trees down???????????? My suggestion: they wd need to BUY  part of the field, and the tree side is "free". Shitty, isn't it!? ⁦@HS2ltd⁩  Again: what the hell are you doing? https://t.co/lARCF6N2Va
@Theo_Pike @EnvAgencyNW @RibbleValleyBC Definitely doable, I can see how!!

@RSPBEngland Thankyou for this ... please keep fighting for Swanscombe ... i don't know it personally but all over the #UK people are fighting for nature's right to exist ... @WWoodlanders @StopWensumLink @SayNo2SizewellC ... wishing you all the best in battle

@YWHelp Tankers arrived pretty much as I pressed send. A bit too late though but very welcome all the same. We can't keep going through this. Our believed beck, our crystal clear, chalk-bed stream, our water voles will all soon be dead. @EnvAgencyYNE

urls.title: Wessex Regional Flood and Coastal Committee (RFCC)
urls.description: We use some essential cookies to make this website work. We’d like to set additional cookies to understand how you use GOV.UK, remember your settings and improve government services. We also use cookies set by other sites to help us deliver content from their services. to ensure there are coherent plans for identifying, communicating and managing flood and coastal erosion risks across catchments and shorelines to encourage efficient, targeted and risk-based investment in flood and coastal erosion risk

tweets.text: Would you like to play a part in local flood and coastal risk management in Wessex? The Environment Agency is looking for 2 new members representing General Interests and Coastal Processes for its Wessex Regional Flood and Coastal Committee. https://t.co/OgXR8sFaeP

@RachSalv @Feargal_Sharkey Why don't the @EnvAgency  say no and tell @AnglianWater  to invest some of their profits in increasing capacity to do the wastewater treatment properly? We all know that extreme precipitation events are likely to increase.

@BurnhamDeepdale @AnglianWater @EnvAgencyAnglia @AnglianWater @EnvAgencyAnglia what exactly are you communicating back with local residents? Appreciate there may be lots you’re considering, but as a local householder, where is the communication and consultation on that?
